alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 2:13PM CDT until March 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Cleveland and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 211 PM CDT, Several public reports of flooded city streets have been received, especially near the University of Oklahoma. Minor flooding is ongoing. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Bethany, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Noble, Harrah, Slaughterville, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Luther and Valley Brook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
